title: Student Success Coordinator (NU.In) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: Work on fair hiring structures to mitigate bias.. My friend and I applied for this position around the same time. I sent my application before her. She gets a phone screening and I don’t, so I assume I wasn’t considered. A month later I get an email inviting me to a PANEL INTERVIEW— where was the phone screening for me? My friend had the panel interview about a week before mine. So basically it was as if I skipped the first interview.. So I have my panel interview and then I call my friend to talk about our experiences. She had COMPLETELY DIFFERENT INTERVIEWERS (2 of the 3 panel interviewers never even conducted an interviewer before). The most annoying thing was that she had completely different questions from mine— and we applied for the SAME position. My questions were specifically about prior experience developing programs and handling crisis management (one would need more experience than I had to answer these). Her questions were more behavioral and student-centered. Congrats to my friend for moving on, but the lack of consistency in this process reveals a lot of red flags.
Interview Questions: 1. How do you go about designing a global element in a program? 2. Describe a time you were facing a crisis with a student. Detail the steps you took to handle and manage it. 3. Describe a time you developed a program that fostered community. (Really unfair my friend did not get any of these questions as well. Nothing for her relating to program development).

title: Resident Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Whole process is taking 5 to 6 months due to a delay in confirming budgets and hiring freezes. These positions have been open for months and they school wont let them fill them until mid or late May. 
It's an exhaustive process with 4 to 5 rounds. Phone, 2 people zoom, on campus or day interview, a call with an executive and a final follow up BEFORE it even passes up to hiring. It's constant for staff but a big wait for potential hires. The questions and such aren't bad. Theres a presentation with a lot of material to review but they provide all of it. For an entry level position this is honestly way too much. If candidates don't drop out themselves they will forced to just it's a lot as an applicant for a bachelor's required position. And the wait time is about a month or more between each round. I'd offer more of the questions but it's been over a month since the last round and I'm still waiting on an answer if I'm hired or not. They are pretty good about communicating thought. It's just a very long process and they are aware.
Interview Questions: None that I remember anymore

I was then invited to an in-person interview which involved a panel as well as a 1:1 interview. I hit it off well with the folks on the panel and left the interview feeling confident, being told I would hear back later that same week. Unfortunately, I did not hear back from any of the people I had spoken with, and instead got an automated rejection from the HR department 2 weeks later. I felt this was an unprofessional way to inform me, given that I had gotten so far in the interview process.
Interview Questions: In which ways do you prefer to communicate? How are you at multitasking and balancing distractions?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: Performed teaching consultation for teaching assistants and across campus, help student with their coding assignment, explain the assignment for them and how they should use their learning in the class
Interview Questions: my grades

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
They keep changing the interview process each year, but generally, you'll have 2-3 rounds. 
In January 2020 it was one group interview, and another round was three 5 minute personal interviews back to back.
Interview Questions: Roleplay based Case studies are very important. Remember to be respectful of people's pronouns, and to be very helpful to people in need

title: Virtual Reality Lab Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Short, board room with 2 people, 1 on 1 with questions and answers, extremely informal. Only a couple of questions were asked, and only one of them was truly gauging my ability to work the job.
Interview Questions: I can't remember exactly but it was a thought process question, asked to give context to the applicant's thought process

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: i applied the position online from their website, and got an email to schedule the in-person interview around a week, i had the interview with two interviewers one was asking questions and the other one was just taking notes, felt a bit weird. the i had a 30 minutes test for my excel skills and then i was told to wait for the outcome.
Interview Questions: why you apply this position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: It was long but still very enjoyable. I learned about the program, the people, and the university. Also got to spend the day with other people in similar role and with the people who were applying to other labs.
Interview Questions: Why Northeastern?

title: COOP Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed over the phone and then after two weeks was brought in to meet with the coop team in the college of engineering. The panel had other faculty coop members.
Interview Questions: How would you relate with engineering students in supply chain program given that you don't have experience with that?

title: RSO Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: An online exam consisting of 30 questions which was timed. The questions were based on the rules and regulations to be followed which consists of scenario based questions. Couple of questions were on the location naming of specific residential building.
Interview Questions: Online exam

title: Senior Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Completed an initial interview with the role's direct report. Then a full set of interviews with every member of the team, plus a person who had served in the role previously.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Yoga Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was an audition and a couple questions. I had to teach as a shadow for another yoga instructor for about 3 months, then I had an audition where I had to create my own yoga sequence for an hour. I had to teach it in front of 2 people and after teaching it they asked me a couple of questions. It was not bad at all, however, it was a long process. I had to do a yoga teacher training before hand to get the credentials.
Interview Questions: How do you know your limits when giving advice in relation to nutrition?

title: Major Gifts Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (New York, NY) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: 10 Minute Preliminary Screening Phone Call with a Talent Recruitment Representative.  She shared about the nature of the position building donor and prospect relationships on the West Coast. No assurances for support, remote technology, and resources to facilitate donor visits seemed scarce.  For a high pressure position, the Gift Officer must be able to access resources online, write nightly reports, request reports, plan and document  next steps, agreements, and get policy  guidance with restricted gift ideas so that relationship with donors can grow.
Interview Questions: Donors area assigned? Company assistant? CRM remotely?  Stewardship reports?

title: Student Support Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions:
three-round interview with a very long processing time, you should be expecting waiting for up to 2 months to get the final deal (either hired or not)

Be prepared that the interviewer could be more than just the hiring manager or your direct boss who is looking for filling a position, it could be a group of their colleges from other departments as well. They would add questions from the outside angle to see how you would react to it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Administrative and Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: They did a phone interview first. After 10 days, I was invited to an in-person interview. 10 days after the in-person interview, they told me that their previous employee decided to come back and they hired her again.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you make a mistake?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with the professor for the course, provided my resume and described my projects and did well on his courses project and exams to get this job. Got an E-mail from the employment office and signed a contract to be employed for a semester
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews total (up to 2 hours long each). I had to complete a testing component for my second interview. I met the entire team, which was pretty intense. The overall application process was not long at all.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with managing budgets?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions:
Within a week of my application, got a response from HR to schedule a phone interview with them.  After initial phone screening, scheduled an onsite interview with the hiring manager, and 2 other members of the team.   The questions asked were geared towards the tasks listed on the role description.  They also asked about my interest in the role and career aspirations.  Everyone was cordial and passionate about working for Northeastern University.

After the meeting, thank you e-mails and additional 2 weeks, I e-mailed HR and a contact for a follow-up on the role.  I did not hear any response and it wasn't until another month later that I found out the position is filled.  Other than the lack of update after, I did learn a lot about more about NEU and the remarkable staff they have.
Interview Questions: Questions picked more on your strengths and interests related to the role applied for.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: 1 day (3) 30 min interviews. Great conversation with hiring manager and supervisor. Feedback was provided after the interview which was extremely helpful. I enjoyed the campus and lab tours. Highly recommend applying here.
Interview Questions: Describe your greatest weakness

title: Events Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: very brief phone call with just one person which i thought was strange.  she did not seem too interested to actually getting to know me and my experience. also it seemed like she tried to tell me that i was not at all qualified for the position.
Interview Questions: what is a challenge you took charge of

title: Administration Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received a personal email from a junior admin asking me to schedule an interview directly with the Dean. Interview was very average, panel style with 2 other staff members from the International office. The job did not seem to be a good fit on either end. I never received any sort of "close the loop" email. I never heard back from anyone at all. That was approx. 6 weeks ago.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Student Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was thorough and straight forward. Be prepared to answer several questions. Questions are about dealing with difficult situations, previous work history. We also spoke a little about what the seasons are and how busy it can be while students are away vs the influx of students when the school year has begun. Also some of example of the situations you might be dealing with while working with the students and families regarding their accounts.
Interview Questions: What are a couple skills you would say are valuable to a company?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Totally directed towards whatever I have written in the resume, more of directed towards project management. Having Salesforce CRM experience it gave me an edge over other candidates. The interview was less difficult to crack but there are tons of candidates applying. SO having a perfect resume and cover letter helps.
Interview Questions: Waterfall vs agile?

title: Computer Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview question and constantly reminding him of that i am seeking for part time opportunities with my studies and let him know why this role interests me. Mostly in the mornings as the employer is free
Interview Questions: Will you do a good job? What Skills do you bring to the table?

title: Cooperative Education Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for 3 different colleges for the role of Cooperative Educatjon Faculty. Interviews started with a phone interview, followed by in person interview with direct supervisor and peer, and then an interview with the dean of student affairs. Ultimately I was turned down from the first role, never heard back on the second and was hired for the third. I was technically referred from the first to the second but the ones who offered me the job were not aware I had applied to other colleges recently.
Interview Questions: How would you encourage a student along in their co-op search if they have limited experience with internships or part-time jobs?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: We emailed back and forth and had a Skype conversation. The procedure was very well set up and talking with the supervisor was great. They were open to discuss my needs.
Interview Questions: My previous experience with tasks assigned to the internship

title: Global Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very lengthy and indicative of a group leadership culture with no one as primary decision maker. Met with 16 people over the course or 2 months. Team based interview style, much of it was remote.
Interview Questions: Asked how business experience outside of higher ed would translate to a university setting.

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Be careful about doing unpaid work for them as part of the interview process...
Applied online and was contacted by a recruiter several weeks later. Had a phone interview that seemed promising and then was asked to complete a "project" to assess my skills. After several hours of work on the project, I submitted it on time and never got any response. After following up with the recruiter, I learned the position is "on hold" indefinitely and they won't be filling it anytime soon. I wasn't too happy to have completed several hours of unpaid work for a position that was apparently not actually going to be filled. 
The recruiter I worked with was very professional, but the hiring manager/department was not.
Interview Questions: General questions about experience with the tasks listed in the job description

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: First I was contacted to schedule a 30 minute phone interview with an HR rep.  A week or two later I had a 60 minute in person interview with the director I would be reporting to directly, 40 minutes.  Then met with a member of the team who had worked there for a very long time, 10 minutes.  At the end I was asked to review and correct a sample press release.  It contained spelling errors, missing and miss used punctuation, run on sentences, and homonyms.  3 weeks later I was called back for a second interview.  I again met with the director, 30 minutes.  Then finally I met with the HR person who I spoke with during my initial phone interview.  I was told I would hear one way or the other by the end of next week.  That date came and went and it has been an additional two weeks without a word.  I sent one email to the HR rep inquiring if a decision had been made and was told they were still thinking about it.  It was between myself and one other candidate I was told.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were in a stressful situation and asked to put an event together with very little and ambiguous information to go on.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was particularly fast. I had just one interview and I knew 3 days after that I got selected. The interview process is easy and they email you right the way to let you know if you continue with the interview process. It is necessary to write a cover letter and resume.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your volunteer experience? 
Describe Ways  or experiences that you have done to Get Out of Your Comfort Zone?

title: Videographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Semi-brief phone interview, One in-person interview with direct boss, then two higher up bosses. Then interview with video team. Everyone was very friendly. Most attention on the reel but surprisingly a focus on the cover letter (for video jobs typically those are very secondary).
Interview Questions: Explain your background on your resume. Video experience.  Storytelling skills.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: I got an email about what professors I would like to meet for the interview because I was qualified for their program. I was able to chose between 4 and 5 professors to interview/chat with
Interview Questions: Do you know GCPR are

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty basic, met with one person for about 30 minutes-was asked normal interview questions. not difficult. then met with more senior person for 10 minutes-again very basic and that was about it.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you fit this role

title: Co-op Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I completed a phone interview followed by in person group interview and individual interview in the same day.  The process was very friendly, simple, and professional. Asked behavioral based questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to coach someone through a difficult decision.

title: Proctor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Had a test on Proctor Manual read well the proctor manual Online test 88% passing marks
Apply early as some of you may not get call 
A parent approaches the station and asks for their son's room number so that they
may send them a care package. What do you do?
Interview Questions: Read proctor Manual well

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: I had a brief phone interview that I felt went well. The expected date for next steps came and went with no further word. I reached out to the interviewer/hiring manager to follow up on my status and never heard back
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone screen and then immediately was called in for 2.5 hours to meet with 4 different people. I was presented with an agenda along with the names and titles of everyone that I was meeting. Very organized.
Interview Questions: How can you help make a difference here?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: 3 steps, first phone interview, then meet with team for team interview, typically have to give small prez, and final round with director from there you typically hear two weeks later if you received position. Sometimes it can take longer
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to the office

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: Initial screening was a video conference call. Next up was a 3 hour in-person interview with the dept head, colleagues, and employees from depts this role works closely with. I was a finalist, but not asked to provide references. They ultimately went with someone with a higher ed background.
Interview Questions: Why Northeastern?

title: Fitness Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my past work experience. Pretty straight forward questions. I was hired on the basis of my approach to handle extreme situations and my passion for fitness.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where the client is not willing to comply?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I worked with a recruiter. I had a 30 minute phone screen with the hiring manager and then came in for a few hours of face to face interviews. The actual process was quick but the time from application to hire was pretty slow for a contractor position. It is also standard that contractors then have to apply for their job to be converted to full time. I had to go through a lengthy interview process when I was converted to full time and then wait a few months to find out if I was hired. It was a bit nerve-wracking.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Scheduling Desk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for one interview with the manager. Basic questions, definitely nothing crazy. They hired me within the same week. I had one full day of training.
Interview Questions: What type of work environment do you do the best work in?

title: Career and Academic Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Charlotte, NC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: After completing the online application, I received an email the very next week for a 15 minute telephone conversation. I was then contacted for a panel interview that would take place in two parts. There were a total of 5 participants. Two from management and 3 who currently work in the position. After that meeting I was scheduled for an interview 1-on-1 with the area AVP. Then next step was to meet with the campus staff. Communication in this office is phenomenal.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to transition from your current institution to NU?

title: Writing Center Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northeastern University in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with 2 professors from the english department who went over my resume and how it would relate to the position at the writing center in addition to seeing why I wanted to work at the writing center
Interview Questions: How would you critique this paper?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: it was very interactive the professor sat with me and told me about his research and future plans and asked me about my interests, projects and future goals. After all of this we discussed about my experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was rather difficult since the position was an advanced research one. There were questions to test quantitative as well as technical knowledge. On the whole a tough nut to crack.
Interview Questions: How would you solve an MLP perceptron algo?

title: Associate Director, Marketing and Communications, Cooperative Education Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: From time of submission to phone screen took 6 months for first initial contact because they were hiring for another position.  I was interviewed by the person who was filling currently filling the role as a contractor and she couldn't really identify what the upcoming projects where.  I submitted to the position online in December, followed up by submitting some portfolio examples to the director via snail mail in early January and then followed up again in late January to the director to find out the status of the position.  I was then told that they are focused on filling another opening first.  I am an alumna of Northeastern's Graduate program.  I was really pushed for a salary which I felt very uncomfortable giving because I didn't have a sense of the position at all.  I indicated that there must be a range online and budget they are working with and the interviewer because defensive to point where I had to say identify that this was not ending on a  positive note"  I am sure my pushback didn't help me but if ranges are identified online that organizations should be willing to identify the range budgeted for the position.  I certainly indicated that I would be willing to negotiate if it were mutually agreed upon that I was the right fit.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background and what interests you in this position?

title: Leadership Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I had three phone interviews, including a video group interview, and a follow up, but something did not feel right. I was receiving mixed messages about the role, expectations, and culture. Withdrew after having more doubts than my gut let me move forward with.
Interview Questions: Communication and leadership style, change management, vision, management

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeastern University in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty typical. Phone screen, heard about three weeks later to come in for an interview in two weeks, had a dual-panel interview [hiring manager for 20 minutes, then other members of  the office for 45 minutes].  Then, a month later - received an email they were still deciding. Month later, still no response...
Interview Questions: They were a set list of questions in a packet from HR that they took notes on then were passing off to HR

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Good communication between the recruiter and applicant, timely/ quick emails. Contacted via email, was scheduled a phone interview immediately. Phone interview was scheduled for 20 minutes and was promptly times, with a lot of questions involving past experiences and goals/ vision for Northeastern in 2017 in line with the President.
Interview Questions: Do you see yourself in this field of work in the next 5-10 years?

title: Creative Design Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: After passing the initial phone interview, which seems pretty standard these days, I was invited in for an in-person. Wow, it was long! I was scheduled to meet with approximately 7 people, but because the hiring manager was late, the whole interview shifted out and some weren't able to make it. It was a long time sitting and interviewing with one after the next, one on one. All were extremely nice, and very thoughtful about their questions. I sent a thank you card (via snail mail) as well as an email to follow-up afterward. Unfortunately, I never heard anything back from anyone.
Interview Questions: There were no out of the ordinary questions here

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was quite straightforward especially if you used to do well as a student in the course. Normally it will not take a long time if you don't have any competition. Once the professor remembers you and you'll be approved for the position in no time.
Interview Questions: Do you think you need additional help for the class?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had to submit a resume and brief essay describing why I wanted the job. There were a lot of candidates and they had to narrow us down to a few workers who could manage 5-10 hours of shifts per week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was a very quick interview. I met with hiring manager, a professor and another admin. It was more a conversation interview, other than just asking me questions, which i liked the most
Interview Questions: Why did you leave sales?

title: Receptionist/Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was with an HR representative for the college which involved a skills test, then there was a phone interview with who would be my direct supervisor, then an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: What is one thing from your current/previous job that you don't like or wish could be better?

title: Government Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a bit too long - with 3 interviews over 3 months. The interviews were enjoyable and not difficult. Overall, a positive experience. I appreciated being notified that I had not been selected.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a great opportunity. The professor there was very nice and the facility was excellent. For research assistant, the questions were all professional. Northeastern is a great university to work at.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in research?

title: Benefits Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone interview. Speedy process. Discussed the position, asked my background, where I went to school, my interests etc. Asked for references and called them on to discuss my interest in the position and to provide details about me and their experience with me and if they should consider me.
Interview Questions: Why I was interested in the position, what my strengths and weaknesses are.

title: International Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University (New York, NY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of two interviews - one phone interview and one Skype interview. They lasted 30-45 minutes. They asked questions about my interest in Northeastern and previous experience dealing with students overseas since the position was based in London.
Interview Questions: What is the one thing that you are most proud of on your resume?

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: I met with four people. One of the four - my third interview - was so rude and unprofessional to me I almost walked out. This individual clearly had expectations for the role that were not reflected in the position as advertised and I did not meet those expectations. I was really thrown by that one. Everyone else was really nice.
Interview Questions: Typical questions asked.

title: Proctor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online followed by a screening through an exam finally training on site. No previous experience required and the whole process is not lengthy at all. All the very best !
Interview Questions: general aptitude.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: not too hard and just talk with the employer. He asked several questions about experience and education background. It maybe just take around 1 hours. But the meeting is easy and happy.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Circulation Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online by selecting and submitting my resume. I received an e-mail that asked me to come to the Snell Library. I went and met up with one of the supervisors who asked me very few questions then welcomed me aboard.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Disability Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeastern University
Interview Descriptions: Very casual, great interviewer, very personable. Completely ignored me once I left. I contacted multiple times and the person did not even have the courtesy or courage to deny my application/interview. If you are not going to give someone a job it is the least you could do to tell them.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied in May of 2016, got an email mid June from a person in that office asking to schedule a phone interview for the following week. After the phone interview I was asked to come in for a group interview two weeks later. The interview went great in my eyes, really hit it off with the staff and upper management. 
Didn't hear from them for over two weeks. Finally I sent an email after almost three weeks asking what their timeline was for filling the position. Hiring manager told me they were going with someone else. 
It is the summer so people were probably on vacation. Worked out for the best though, got an offer from another University in Boston.
Interview Questions:
What do you contribute to the team?
Why do you want to join the NU team?
What is your work ethic like
What work environment best suits your needs

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had my first interview with assistant deans. I was called back for a second,  day long interview with various staff members and students. I also met with the dean. The hardest part was the staff and student meetings.
Interview Questions: How to address diversity issues.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northeastern University in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process as a whole wasn't bad. The questions weren't particularly difficult, however they looked at communication cues more than anything (eye contact, fidgeting, etc.) If you want to work in the co-op department, have these skills down. If you are applying to any other area of the university, I highly recommend networking beforehand to get the position. It never hurts but at Northeastern since it is so pre-professional, you need to have your stuff together so you can show students how to network too.
Interview Questions: What did you want to be right out of college?

title: Full Time Lecturer Interview

raduate students to improve their skills in teaching, research, and other activities while pursuing their graduate education. Graduate students seeking assistantships should present themselves in the most favorable light to get the attention of campus units offering assistantships. Following is a list of tips recommended by several units on campus that offer excellent advice for those seeking graduate employment.
Know what a campus unit does before applying for an assistantship there. Check the campus unit’s website or promotional materials and make sure you have the necessary skills to contribute to that campus unit.
Before visiting a campus unit, contact its main office and find out if it has assistantships available, and if so, whom to contact about the assistantship and how to submit your application. Avoid walking in to an office without an appointment or going door to door individually or in groups to find this information.
Know that academic departments are different from support units when it comes to assistantship positions. In an academic department, individual faculty may have research assistantships available, but in a support unit, the head of that unit usually hires all graduate assistants. Some campus units may also advertise its assistantship openings by direct mailings to campus units or through Human Resource Services.
Before applying for an assistantship, know all the requirements related to graduate assistantships. This may include course load, GPA, working hours and immigration authorization (if you are an international student) requirements. You may be able to find these requirements from your academic department or from the Graduate School, International Student and Faculty Office and Human Resource Services.
Prepare your application materials to suit the assistantships available from a particular campus unit. Your resume should contain up-to-date information and should be spell-checked and carefully proofread. Be certain all the information in your resume, including your GPA, is accurate and current.
Make sure your email addres

title: Senior Web Applications Developer Interview

After passing a 30-minute phone screening interview, I was invited for a 3-hour interview on site. The interview was scheduled for the time slot from 11:30 AM until 2:30 PM.  No food or beverages were offered or provided, despite the fact that this long interview lasted through lunch time.  Also, I met with several groups of people, each for 30 minutes.  It didn't seem fair that they could meet with me briefly either before or after lunch, while I had no such break.

After I sent thank you emails to each group with whom I interviewed, the hiring manager responded with an email asking me if I would be available for lunch the following week.  But without explanation, he failed to confirm a date and time for our lunch meeting.  A couple of weeks later, I received an email stating that I was no longer being considered for this position.  When I called the HR recruiter, no explanation was provided.

This interview led to a second round interview where I had to present to about 15 of my potential colleagues on the subject matter I would eventually be working in and try to convince them to do business with us. title: Admissions Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Quick initial phone screen followed a week later by a 1/2 day of in-person interviews on campus. Lots of group/panel interviews to the point it was excessive and involved employees who did not work in the same department and who had little to do with the job (and had no supervisory role over the position). Some members on panels did not appear to interview people often and asked inappropriate questions...which means the interviewee has to come up with diplomatic non-responses. Some panel members are were on their smartphones during the interview and not paying much attention. Received verbal and written offer within two weeks after interview after references were checked and background check conducted.

Total time from application-to-offer was about three months. Human Resources played a very minimal role, but this depends a lot on how hands-on the hiring manager is about hiring.

While internal candidates do have an advantage, it is definitely still possible to get an interview and even an offer at Northeastern simply by applying online, even if you do not know anyone at Northeastern. Of Boston-area universities, Northeastern would count as one of institutions that does less internal hiring and promotion.
Interview Questions: Aside from the handful of inappropriate questions, most questions were a mix of experience-based and behavioral

title: Backup Supervisor, University Library Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northeastern University (Boston, MA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Not a very long interview. Interviewer was my supervisor-to-be and he asked me very general questions on what I had done in the past, what responsibilities I had taken in the past and if I had ever managed any workplace / group / event. He asked me what I would do in the case of (given scenario) and the scenario was a simple library emergency in case of fire or how to manage other subordinates or how would I behave with other library patrons.
Interview Questions: He asked me what I would do in the case of (given scenario) and the scenario was a simple library emergency in case of fire or how to manage other subordinates or how would I behave with other library patrons.

title: Web Manager Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email from the hiring manager who wanted to set up a phone interview. At the end of our phone interview she invited me in for an in person interview. The in person interview lasted about 2-3 hours and involved several different people. I did not get an offer but did not receive any sort of notification after the interview-  just heard nothing. I would have appreciated them letting me know that they went with another candidate.
Interview Questions: No overly difficult questions. Wanted specific examples of the types of work and projects I had done prior. The hiring manager was friendly but the rest of the team seemed to have an over inflated sense of importance.
